p: There were no significant differences ( P > 0.05) in D. moldavica leaf area (LA) between years (Fig. 8). Averaged over the years, without ABA application, plants grown in the well-watered condition, had the greatest LA (820.75 cm 2 plant −1), which was 67.17% and 86.53% higher than moderate and severe conditions, respectively. The effects of the variables watering regimes, ABA and interaction of ABA × watering regimes on LA were significant at P < 0.0001. In all three moisture regimes, leaf area showed a negative response to ABA application, and decreased with increasing ABA concentrations (Fig. 8). The lowest leaf area was obtained from 40 μM ABA concentration in all moisture regimes, which was 63.08%, 53.43% and 60.19% lower than control under well-watered, moderate and severe drought conditions, respectively.
